0: Missing snowboarder Julie Abrahamsen has been found alive three days after she was last seen on Blackcomb Mountain near Whistler, B.C. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Search and Rescue found the 21-year-old woman on Saturday more than five kilometres from the ski boundary of Whistler Blackcomb. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A helicopter spotted her tracks in the snow, followed them from the air, and found her in extremely rugged terrain at an elevation of 1,600 metres near Upper Wedge Creek. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Julie Abrahamsen was found after three days on Wedge Mountain near Whistler, B.C. (Facebook) Brad Sills, senior manager for Whistler SAR said he was elated and joyed to see that Abrahamsen was alive and in good conditions despite being dehydrated. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "These moments are big for us because we don't get enough of them quite simply," he said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "To find someone with a strong spirit who is able to endure the past three nights of weather â€” that's a big win for all of us. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR RCMP will now try to piece together how Abrahamsen ended up so far from the ski boundary. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "It's not an area that would've been accessible by just riding your snowboard out," said Sgt. Rob Knapton. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "There definitely would have been a significant amount of walking involved, but it is in the direction that you could go from Blackcomb when you enter the backcountry," he said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "Despite the rain, the temperatures have been higher, so it made it a little bit better chance of surviving," Knapton said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Abrahamsen's roommate reported the 21-year-old missing on Friday. She was last seen on Wednesday Jan. 21 and RCMP were able to confirm she accessed the lifts on Blackcomb's Glacier Express chairlift at 11 a.m. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Julie Abrahamsen's father (right) said he was grateful his daughter (left) was found alive. (Facebook) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Her father, KnutPeder Abrahamsen, posted on Facebook from Norway on Saturday that he was relieved she was found. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "I love my three children and grateful and happy to still have all of them," he said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Abrahamsen is an avid snowboarder and went on many trips with her family and friends. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR On mobile?
